MyMinesweeper.GUI

Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • MyMinesweeper.GUI.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    This class represents the panel that manage the GUI for a game.
    Author:
    Lucie
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • scaleImage

        private javax.swing.ImageIcon scaleImage(java.lang.String imgPath,
                                         int width,
                                         int height)
        Returns an rescaled version of images in order to use it as icons
        Parameters:
        imgPath - : path of initial image we want to scale
        width - : width of new ImageIcon
        height - : height of new ImageIcon
        Returns:
        a rescaled ImageIcon with given dimensions

      • updateSquare

        public void updateSquare(int i,
                         int j,
                         int state)
        Update the graphical representation of a square on screen when its state has changed
        Parameters:
        i - : the row of the square to update
        j - : the row of the square to update
        state - : an integer representing the new state of the square Normal = -2, Flag = -1, From 0 to 8 : Open with such number of adjacent mines BlackMine = 9, RedMine = 10, Frozen Normal = 11, Frozen Flag = 12

      • updateMines

        public void updateMines(int num)
        Update the graphical display of mine counter when flags are added or removed. Of course the position and number of flags are not necessarily right, so the number displayed can be negative.
        Parameters:
        num - The remaining mines not found (total - nb of flags)

      • updateCounter

        public void updateCounter(int count)
        Update graphical display of time counter every second when asked by Game instance
        Parameters:
        count - Number of seconds that elapsed since game began.

      • endGame

        public void endGame(java.lang.Boolean hasWon,
                    int timeSpent)
        Manage graphical response to provide when game is finished (dialog box with results, change of the smiley on top with cool or dead face)
        Parameters:
        hasWon - : true in case of victory, false in case of defeat
        timeSpent - : number of seconds since the beginning of the game

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Manage response to Mouse click events made by user (right or left clik on squares). The event taken into account is a click event, so if you move the mouse when clicking it will not work
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
